pullRequest.title: Fix for OpenSSLTest.testNodeClientSSL failure
pullRequest.bodyText:
Issue #, if available:
Description of changes:

Initialize "path.data", "path.logs" and "path.home" for every ES Node started during tests
Change "path.data", "path.logs" and "path.home" to use "target/data"

By submitting this pull request, I confirm that you can use, modify, copy, and redistribute this contribution, under the terms of your choice.

nodes.bodyText: nit: this setting seems to be repeated on line 620.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -605,19 +605,23 @@ public void testNodeClientSSL() throws Exception {
                 .build();
 
         setupSslOnlyMode(settings);
-        
+
         RestHelper rh = nonSslRestHelper();
 
         final Settings tcSettings = Settings.builder().put("cluster.name", clusterInfo.clustername).put("path.home", ".")
                 .put("node.name", "client_node_" + new Random().nextInt())
                 .put("node.data", false)
                 .put("node.master", false)
                 .put("node.ingest", false)
+                .put("path.data", "./target/data/"+clusterInfo.clustername+"/ssl/data")
+                .put("path.logs", "./target/data/"+clusterInfo.clustername+"/ssl/logs")
+                .put("path.home", "./target")
+                .put("discovery.initial_state_timeout","8s")

commit.message:
- Initialize "path.data", "path.logs" and "path.home" for every ES Node started during tests
- Change "path.data", "path.logs" and "path.home" to use "target/data"

afterCommit.message:
- Initialize "path.data", "path.logs" and "path.home" for every ES Node started during tests
- Change "path.data", "path.logs" and "path.home" to use "target/data"

nodes.bodyText:
The changes look good, but I was wandering if using prefix "./target" is a good idea ?
I saw that this folder is used for the output jars during package build.
Maybe instead we should create some temporary folders or use different prefix "test-target" (or anything that contains test) .
Do we have other tests that also use "./target" ?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -75,7 +75,9 @@ public void testNodeClientAllowedWithServerCertificate() throws Exception {
                 .put("node.data", false)
                 .put("node.master", false)
                 .put("node.ingest", false)
-                .put("path.home", "/tmp")
+                .put("path.data", "./target/data/" + clusterInfo.clustername + "/cert/data")
